item.title: The Aerial Journey of a Soldier Through WWII
item.description: The Aerial Journey of a Soldier Through WWII

item.title: The Different Torture Techniques I Experienced
item.description: I tried something new, and it definitely paid off! Watch how this simple idea transformed into a surprisingly awesome result.

item.title: The Last Thing I Remember Was Mortars Coming At Me
item.description: The Last Thing I Remember Was Mortars Coming At Me

item.title: Corpsman Earns Three Purple Hearts Saving Marines in Vietnam
item.description: I’m sharing the story of a brave corpsman who risked everything to save Marines, earning three Purple Hearts in the process.

item.title: The Ultimate Sacrifice of a Combat Leader
item.description: This is the powerful true story of a combat leader who gave everything for his men. Through chaos and danger, his bravery became a beacon—showing what it means to lead from the front and make the ultimate sacrifice.

item.title: We Found 42 IEDs on One Road
item.description: I’m recounting the intense experience of uncovering 42 explosive devices on one route—highlighting the dangers faced in conflict zones.

item.title: I Ended My War In A Beautiful Way
item.description: Reflecting on my final moments in service, I share the meaningful experience that helped me end my time at war with a sense of closure and purpose.

item.title: The Battle of Chosin Reservoir: The Incredible Story of Pat Finn
item.description: The Battle of Chosin Reservoir: The Incredible Story of Pat Finn

item.title: Green Beret's Solo Triumph Against Enemy Forces
item.description: Green Beret's Solo Triumph Against Enemy Forces

item.title: She Bought Him a .45 to Defend Himself
item.description: She Bought Him a .45 to Defend Himself

item.title: Navy Corpsman Fights Back Against Enemy Ambush
item.description: During a 1966 ambush in Vietnam, Corpsman Robert Ingram was shot four times while treating wounded Marines. He kept going—saving lives under fire and earning the Medal of Honor.

item.title: From Vietnam to NFL: Rocky Bleier's Legacy of Courage
item.description: Wounded in Vietnam, Rocky Bleier defied the odds to return to pro football—becoming a four-time Super Bowl champion and symbol of resilience on and off the field.

item.title: Rudy: The 27-Seconds That Changed My Life
item.description: After serving in the Navy, Rudy Ruettiger chased his dream of playing football at Notre Dame. His legendary 27 seconds on the field became a moment of lasting inspiration.

item.title: Operation Dragoon vs. Operation Overlord
item.description: When his fiancée didn’t return, he sensed something was off. His instincts would soon lead to a deeper investigation into her disappearance.

item.title: How We Escaped a Burning Sherman Tank
item.description: A WWII veteran recounts the harrowing moment his Sherman tank caught fire under enemy attack—and how quick thinking and courage helped the crew make it out alive.

item.title: How Military Service Helped Rudy Reach Notre Dame
item.description: Before becoming a football legend, Rudy Ruettiger served in the U.S. Navy—an experience that built the discipline and drive he needed to chase his dream of playing for Notre Dame.

item.title: A Baptism of Fire on the Shores of Normandy
item.description: A D-Day veteran recalls his first moments under fire during the Normandy landings—an intense introduction to combat that defined the courage and sacrifice of June 6, 1944.

item.title: Three Shells Passed Right Over My Head in Normandy
item.description: A WWII veteran recalls a close call during the Normandy invasion, where three artillery shells passed just overhead—one of many powerful stories from the front lines of D-Day.

item.title: Why Patton Gave Us The Name "Tough 'Ombres"
item.description: Learn how Gen. George S. Patton honored the 90th Infantry Division with the nickname “Tough ‘Ombres” during WWII—recognizing their grit and bravery in the European theater.
